intro: Gnaphalium evaciforme, commonly known as the slender everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow to brown flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium evaciforme is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
